title: Contributing Factor in Long Island Sound Pollution

content.description: Long Island Sound is a body of water off the northeast coast of the United States. Over nine million people live in the small watershed area that feeds into the sound. To determine the effect of the population density on the watershed, scientists measured the oxygen content of bottom waters in the sound. The data from late summer 2013 are displayed in the map below.
content.question: Which of the following factors would most likely contribute to the conditions observed in the Long Island Sound?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain how environmental concepts and processes represented visually relate to broader environmental issues.
